bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 28, 1902

div1.p: Mabel Lazear empathizes with Sweitzer regarding her financial losses. She asks for dates from Lazear's life to send to Paton.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 28, 1902
div1.p:
Your
welcome letter received
yesterday. I can't tell
you how badly I feel
for you this loss at Gilman.
It is a perfect shame-
I am hoping to hear they
will be able to pay up some-
thing. I suppose the proper
thing for me to do will
be to send you back the
check when they return
it from the Bank - I so
wish I could return you
generously at a time like
this by sending you some-
thing. I would try not
to worry if I were you
I know it is so easy to
tell a person that - I know
you will be brave because
you always are-

I sent you a post card
from Lake Tahoe. It was
a most wonderfully beauti-
ful trip. I had forgotten
that the Lake and the
mountain were so beautiful
I write with the Blisses
and Edith Pillsbury
We were dreadfully swell
and had a special train
to take us from Truckee
to Tahoe and steam launches
on the Lake when ever
we wanted them - the
Lake is only 27 miles long
and 13 miles wide- I traveled
in a decided delightful
way as my trip cost me
just 25 cents a fee to a
porter- I am writing
to ask you if you will
please send the
following dates to Dr
Paton he asked me
for them and I thought
I might make a mis-
take I am not sure
about the B. & B.P. & S. one -
after you send them
to him will you send
them to me - I told Dr
Paton I would ask you
to send him the dates.
I shall I have to answer
his letter this morning
so will close with much
love from Mabel & the
Babies
